title: Some people think schools should group pupils according to their academic ability, but others believe pupils with different abilities should be educated together. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
content:
Different academic abilities exist among students, according to discipline, intelligence, and hard work. Some schools believe students should be grouped into different levels, depending on academic performance, while others disagree. In my view, this should never happen, as it induces numerous issues in both classes. The following paragraphs will explore both sides of the argument and highlight why I support one side.

Indeed, overachievers feel underwhelmed when faced with the workload average pupils receive. It simply does not satisfy them to know they have locked potential, all due to their fellow classmates’ inability to match their own standards. Above average students tend to feel more hungry for knowledge, looking for an actual challenge, which is somewhat understandable. By dividing a class into two, that could be achieved. Instant fiery competitiveness is induced between the overachieving classmates. Likewise, longer hours of teaching the academically average group makes a lot of sense, to ensure they understood the topic and to address any questions they may have. In addition to that, the A+ group can be introduced to advanced level topics, in order to fully unleash their potential, and satisfy their hunger for knowledge.

On the other hand, new problems show up once a class of supposedly the same grade, is split up into two categories. This, essentially, implies to the classmates that there is a superior group and a dumb one. Consequently, members of the “dumb class” will feel inadequate, and immediately lose self-esteem and thus, their motivation. On top of that, the upper division will most likely adopt a superiority complex that leads to looking down upon their peers. A larger workload of homework is bound to inspire a feeling of unfairness among the lower level, as well as applying pressure on the higher level to naturally acquire that knowledge without the same amount of homework. To make the situation further complicated, not every school can afford paying double the salary for each grade.

In conclusion, natural excellence is a blessing and a curse in disguise. While the academically blessed may score large numbers in tests, they feel bored being in the same classroom as less fortunate peers. Dividing the two solves that, while causing even greater problems, such as insecurity or lack of motivation. My opinion, ultimately, is that splitting colleagues of the same grade into two is harmful more than is helpful.

title: What are the pros and cons for children of watching television?
content:

As a result, a great number of children are fond of watching cartoons or family films on TV. There are both advantages and disadvantages to this. In this ,essay I am going to examine how kids benefit from televisions and what drawbacks there are.

First of all, watching TV can be beneficial for children's development as there are millions of programmes with educational elements. Besides specific programmes with the only aim to teach a kid something about the natural world or literacy, there are family films. Not only do they entertain children but also introduce them to the basics of  life such as kindness, tolerance and love. 

Another advantage for kids watching TV is that they can obtain patience. The ability to sit still is very useful since it can come in handy at school, college or even work. What is more, when youngsters watch movies or animated movies, they learn to focus all their attention on the screen which can help them to develop concentration.

However, according to  scientific ,research it is proven that watching television is harmful to the eyes. Consequently, spending a lot of time in front of a TV screen can lead to visual impairment, which is a common problem among young people. 

Furthermore, television can be addictive ,especially for little boys and girls. A lot of parents use cartoons as a way to calm their youngsters, which can result in a child's obsession with TV. In this case, a youngster becomes more interested in the imaginary world, shown in films and animated movies than in reality. Finally, a child can find it hard to socialize in the community.

To sum up, watching TV can be both advantageous and disadvantageous for kids, as they can learn something new but it can result in worsening of their eyesight. Following this, the pros overweight the cons since parents can control the amount of time their infants spend in front of the screen in order to prevent negative effects.

This essay aims to delve into the significance of regular exams for teenagers in secondary school, focusing on how they contribute to preparing students for life after graduation. Moreover, regular exams encourage students to challenge their own assumptions and develop a deeper understanding of the subjects they are studying.

Another argument in favour of regular examinations at the secondary school level is their ability to instil a sense of accountability in teenagers. Exams provide students with a tangible measure of their progress and performance, as well as a benchmark against which they can evaluate their achievements. This accountability not only motivates them to put in their best effort but also prepares them for the feedback and evaluation systems they may encounter in higher education or the workplace. Furthermore, the sense of accountability cultivated through regular examinations encourages students to take ownership of their learning and sets the stage for a proactive approach to personal growth.

Regular examinations are undeniably valuable in preparing teenagers for the challenges they will face after leaving secondary school. By fostering critical thinking skills, cultivating time management, and instilling a sense of accountability, these exams contribute to the holistic development of students. Even though some may argue against the stress and pressure that exams may bring, it is crucial to recognize that real-life situations often demand individuals to perform under pressure. title: Most people agree that money cannot buy happiness. Why is happiness difficult to define? How can people achieve happiness?
content:
Whether money can buy happiness has been an ongoing debate for many years. Happiness is one of the most difficult emotions to define as there are multiple factors which determine one’s contentment in life. I will be proposing a few ideas on how one can achieve happiness.

Firstly, we have to define what is happiness? For some it may be family, for others it is having abundant wealth. Therefore, the meaning of happiness is incredibly difficult to determine. Moreover, in recent studies, multiple factors have been used to attempt to define happiness. These include, living conditions, wealth, family, etc. For example, a poorer person in Africa may not have wealth, but have family which gives them enough happiness. This is why some of these studies are not reliable but may be able to give some indication of how happiness can be measured.

There are some ways people can be happier. The main way would be to prioritise what makes them happy. As discussed above, this can vary from person to person. Moreover, a big reason people are not happy in modern society is that their focus is always on what they don’t have as opposed to what they do have. Consequently, making them feel empty and dissatisfied with life. Therefore, being grateful is a key factor to achieve happiness and practicing being grateful can be quite simple. For example, every morning, people can write down three things they are grateful for before starting their day.

In conclusion, happiness is very personal and may have a different meaning to each person. Being able to identify what makes a person happy and focusing on that would be the way to achieve happiness. There are no set parameters so everyone’s journey is different.

title: Some people believe that it is the responsiblity of individuals to take care of their own health and diet. Others, however, believe that gorvernments should make sure that their citizens have a healthy diet. Discuss both views, and give your opinion.
content:
With respect to the topic referring to who should shoulder the responsibility for citizens' health and diet, many contend that it is the government's task to maintain individuals' fitness, while others opine that it is something that residents should take into consideration.

　　On one hand, the fitness level of citizens plays a significant role in the development of society, which means the government is regarded to emphasize that. It is alleged that the majority of illness, such as a huge proportion of gastric perforation and enterogastritis, is generally attributed to the unhealthy or unreasonable diet of inhabitants. Hence, encouraging individuals to form a reasonable and balanced diet habit serves as an effective and efficient way to diminish the rate of illness. In this case, the pressure of an overloaded medical system can be released to a great degree, which means the government can distribute more funds to other domains.

　　 On the other hand, it is unpractical, unresponsible and unrealistic to transfer the responsibility that residents should take to the government. Individuals ought to take the initiative to attend to themselves. Unlike infants, most citizens are equipped with the ability to take care of themselves. It's nearly effortless for individuals to form a healthy diet spontaneously, while it is of great difficulty for the government to spur citizens into action. For instance, even if the authority enforces a related status, it cannot be implemented without the cooperation of individuals.

　　In my opinion, while the authority should get involved in the forming of a diet, individuals are expected to shoulder the main responsibility. The government, possessing a wide range of functions, ought to invest the energy and capital into other fields such as military units and police force, rather than some domain that individuals should take over. Only by distributing duties scientifically and reasonably, can  society function well and march on.

title: We should return to traditional and older values of respect for family and community. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is claimed that modern society should re-embrace the time-honored, traditional values of family and community that it has abandoned. In my point of view, it is true that more importance  should indeed be attached to the household and collectivism, but it seems unrealistic to apply those old values in contemporary society.  

Admittedly, more appreciation toward our family and community would help to strengthen family bonding and promote social cohesion. Individualism has eroded the younger generation, making them indifferent to what happens in their own communities or even in their own homes. Once old-fashioned concepts come back, people can be unconsciously influenced and thereby spend more time accompanying their family members and giving an ear to their elderly parents. In the meantime, more participation and support from neighbours would be seen in all kinds of communal activities. This progress, viewed in the long run, will necessarily bring a united and harmonious nation.

However, when trying to arouse people’s awareness of respecting their family units or communities, the risk of hypercorrection should not be ignored. This is because, being well-educated and growing up in this enlightened society, people nowadays have stronger individual consciousness and refuse to have their lives arranged. Facing the huge generation gap, some people may have to sacrifice their personal choices and values and submit to the preference of their parents, if asked to “respect” the decision made by their family. Worse still, some minority groups, in order to be more socially accepted, are likely to weaken their identity and follow the modern social trend blindly, which will also pose a threat to our social diversity.

In conclusion, we are supposed to pay more attention to  traditional family values and the sense of community, but it does not mean that these old ideas should be fully accepted in this ever-evolving world.

title:
In some cultures, children are often told that they can achieve anything if they try hard enough.

What are the advantages and disadvantages of giving children this message?
content:
For a long time, society views hard work as a prime determination in achieving success.  In this following essay, I will discuss thoroughly the positive and negative impacts and provide some evidence of this behaviour towards children.

First and foremost, promoting hard work can be advantageous for young people in some ways. Maximizing effort is essential to sharpening persistent and resilient skills. With these skills, children are able to adapt to difficult situations and find the solution to solve the issues that may occur. For instance, in order to achieve straight A’s, students must prioritize and be willing to commit to homework, long-hour mentoring sessions, and practice with various kinds of tests with different levels of difficulty. However, hard work must be done with consistency. Hence, by combining these two attitudes, children will perform much better and leading to higher chances of success.

On the other hand, hard work may bring an unpleasant impact on children. A long-haul discipline without any rest may cause burnout and disrupt the mental health condition. For example, if we force children to study without any rest or day off, success is not something that is close to achieving, instead they will get stressed which even leads to depression. To ease some pressures, it is important for children to have some personal traits, such as holidays or going out with friends. Furthermore, aside from taking some time off, setting goals and purposes may also help young people to map out their effort and know what to achieve. 

To conclude, indeed hard work motivates children in achieving their goals and dreams. However, it is also important to note, a hard effort may bring pressure which leads to harmful impacts. Hence, setting clear goals and having some time off may balance the negative impact of hard work.

title: More and more people want to study at university, so competition of university places is increasing. Why do more people want to study at university? Is it positive or negative?

Worse still, unemployment is another painful consequence brought by "college fever" .It can be noticed that in many countries, the graduation season coincides with the unemployment season during the gradually losing competitiveness of university students. 

In conclusion, it is understandable that applicants spare no effort to win a place in their dream school, yet the profound influence needs to be critically and carefully analyzed.

title: Some people believe that all children should learn second language from the time they start school, while others believe that it is better to wait until a child is at secondary school. Discuss both views and give Your opinion
content:
Owing to the irreversible trend of globalization, people are motivated to learn foreign languages for overseas travel and study. Some argue that students should acquire a second language once they attend school whilst others contend that they should start during secondary school. It is obvious that learning a second language early in earlier childhood can enhance students’ international competitiveness in both academic and career aspects. On the contrary, the amount of time can be invested in sensory motor development if young kids start learning foreign languages during secondary education, leading to better holistic development. From my perspective, I believe that the two ideations stand their ground, depending on the parenting styles. 

Undoubtedly, language abilities such as speaking and writing skills are inherently important assets for people who pursue international study and overseas employment. Take Hong Kong as an example, English is a core subject in the standard proper education system, which requires students to learn as early as in kindergartens. Most of the learners in Hong Kong need to go through intensive English training during their study journeys. As a result, the majority of Hong Kong students are capable of using Chinese and English upon graduation, leading to a solid bilingual background for them to strike for better chances in employment in multinational companies and to study abroad, such as the United States and the United Kingdom. (compared to neighbouring cities such as those Japan, Korea, China and Taiwan, HK students speak better English because they start it at an early stage

On the flip side, instead of a new language, parents can focus on the sensory-motor training, which is valuable for the early development in child’s the infancy stage. For example, an increasing numbers of parents nowadays tend to provide training in swimming for toddlers because this sport can effectively build up their physical strength and coordination between body muscles, sensory systems and concentration ability. Apart from learning new languages, the development of these abilities can not be overlooked and the delay of language learning, when compared to a holistic development, can be deemed a reasonable action. 

To sum up, both sides of this topic are supported by legitimate arguments about the advantages of their stands. Personally, I support that parents should let their children learn in the best interest of early childhood development, instead of blindly following either side. (blindly follow suit/ due to peer and social pressure)

title: Many people use new forms of technology to communicate these days. What are the positive effects of this trend on personal and professional relationships? Could online forms of communication lead to superficial connections?
content:
In our modern time, people relay information differently as a result of technological advancement. In my opinion, relationships have, for the most part, improved in two major ways through this phenomenon. I am also convinced the use of new means of communication, made available through the Internet, could potentially give rise to less meaningful interactions.

It is my view that, on a personal level, technology has enabled us to stay in touch more easily. People used to communicate through the postal system if they wished to contact someone who lived far from them. This system was cumbersome and often led to loss of connection. Through programs such as Skype or WhatsApp, everyone can now speak to their friends and relatives around the world whenever they please. In addition, whereas working professionals had limited opportunity to get to know their colleagues before, they can, at the present time, use various websites to find out about them. Website such as Instagram or LinkedIn have helped staff members to find common interests to talk about at work.

I further believe that Internet-based platforms sway individuals into staying connected mainly in the virtual world. For example, there are people who have hundreds of friends on sites such as Facebook, yet they rarely speak to them about important issues in life. Another reason why relationship mat at times remain superficial could be attributed to impaired social skills. Since some people refrain from socializing in real-life situations and instead chat with others through the Internet, they fail to establish deep connections through face-to-face communication. The youth, in particular, might prefer to spend their time online and miss the chance to practice their skills to form intimate relationships.

In conclusion, technological innovations have revolutionized both our personal and professional lives by allowing us to communicate with friends, relatives and colleagues less effortfully. We can also discover a lot more about others’ interests through social media. From my  perspective, however, since more people prefer to spend their time online, missing the chance to develop their social skills, engaging in cutting-edge forms of communication could diminish the depth of their relationships.

In conclusion, there is an increasing number of people who take shopping as their favourite leisure activity because they can talk with friends and foster their connections in this progress, and this trend can be both advantageous to individuals by allowing for enough exercise and becoming healthier, and to the society as a whole by promoting the economy.

title: Many people send and receive emails in business and in their personal life. Do the advantages of using the email outweigh the disadvantages?
content:
A large number of people utilize the email service to carry out their professional tasks and for attending to their personal affairs. While there are some drawbacks associated with using this means of communication, I believe the main benefits are more substantial.

On the one hand, a potential disadvantage may be misapprehension resulting from an email exchange. Since emotions and tone of speech are, at times, difficult to convey properly through the written form, the content of an email, too, might upset or aggravate someone. For instance, a manager’s announcement could sound forceful when organizing a meeting with the staff through email and frustrate the employees. Another negative is receiving unwanted electronic mail known as spam. These messages contain harmful pieces of virus. I, personally, become rather alarmed when my inbox is cluttered by spam.

On the other hand, a primary advantage of using the email service is fast communication. Whereas in the past, hand-written letters used to take a long time to be delivered, the email technology has made it possible to send and receive mail almost instantly. In business, where people tend to make work-related arrangements on a daily basis, using this service is extremely useful. A further benefit is that the email is accessible in most places around the globe. If one wishes to contact their friends or relatives overseas, there is a good chance that they will be able to connect to the Internet and send an email.

On balance, it is true that using emails to exchange information would seem disadvantageous under certain circumstances. However, in my view, its positive effects on the speed of communication as well as the accessibility of this service override the downsides.

title: Success is often measured in wealth and material belongings. Do you think wealth is the best measure for success? What makes a person successful?

title: Plastic bags, plastic bottles, and plastic packaging are bad for the environment. What damage does plastic do to the environment and people? What can be done by governments and individuals to solve this problem?
content:
Plastic pollution has become a critical environmental issue. As the world’s population increases rapidly, so does the amount of disposable plastic in form of soda cans, food wrappers, or bags. This will wreak havoc on both animal species and humans, but if some practices are implemented by the ruling class of countries and individuals, this problem can be addressed. 

Plastic products can put the lives of animals and people in jeopardy. To begin with, foam paper, cups, and food containers are often left on the beaches by many dwellers or holidaymakers. As a result, great quantities of plastic will find their way into sea life, where creatures will either ingest micro-particles or choke on them to death. This, in turn, will upset the food chain as the lives of larger animals in the sea or on the land depend heavily on smaller creatures poisoned by plastic. Plastic also poses a grave threat to humans. Dumping these products in landfills and then burning them is highly likely to release poisonous chemicals that have deleterious effects on human life such as long-term respiratory problems.

Having said that, there are ways to address the problem with regard to plastic use. Firstly, the onus is on the government to take meaningful measures to oversee the ways in which plastic is produced. One such measure is to prevent factories from using production methods that are far from environmentally friendly and instead reward those trying to recycle. At the same time, people should also shop more responsibly. When going to a grocery store or a restaurant, they can carry reusable cotton bags, drinking bottles, and cutlery as opposed to disposable ones, thereby promoting the culture of green life while reducing the mass discard of plastic.

To sum up, with plastic products continuing to exist in the environment for hundreds of years to come, affecting both animals, sea animals in particular, as well as humans, the government and individuals should make a concerted effort to mitigate the severity of such a crisis.

title: Many people fail to achieve a balance between work and other parts of their lives. What are the reasons and how to solve the problem
content:
Maintaining a balance between work and other aspects of life has become increasingly challenging for many individuals. This essay explores the reasons behind this struggle and provides effective strategies to address this issue so as to foster a healthier work-life balance.

Several factors contribute to the difficulties in balancing work and life. Firstly, the availability of technological devices and communication tools has blurred the boundaries between professional and personal life. Constant connectivity makes it almost unfeasible to disconnect from work, resulting in extended working hours. Secondly, workplace culture and societal expectations often prioritize productivity and long working hours over personal well-being. Thirdly, personal ambition and the desire to succeed professionally can lead individuals to neglect their personal lives, causing an imbalance.

To strive for work-life harmony, one should define specific working hours and create designated spaces for working tasks and relaxation and communicate these boundaries with colleagues and family to manage expectations. Besides, recognizing the importance of self-care activities, such as exercise, hobbies, and spending quality time with loved ones, is the key to reaching equilibrium. People should schedule regular breaks, engage in activities that bring joy and relaxation, and practice mindfulness or meditation to recharge and rejuvenate. What is more, it is crucial to learn how to manage time efficiently by prioritizing tasks, setting realistic goals, and avoiding multitasking. In the meanwhile, one needs to be able to identify time-wasting routines and minimize distractions, maximizing productivity and leaving room for personal activities.

To conclude, retaining a work-life balance determines one’s overall happiness. By setting boundaries, prioritizing self-care, and managing time effectively, individuals can create a more balanced and fulfilling life, integrating both personal and professional spheres harmoniously.

First of all, solar panels on the roof of a normal house take energy from the sun and then transport this energy into DC. Next, the current  is passed to the inverter, which turns it into AC and regulates the supply of electricity. Finally, if the solar power does not provide enough supply, the electricity will flow back by the utility grid into the household through the meter.

title: The typical teaching situation of a teacher and students in the class will not exist by the year 2050.

The traditional classroom setting of a teacher instructing a group of students may be considered outdated by the year 2050. While I agree that the role of teachers and students in the classroom may change, I believe that the traditional teaching situation will still exist to some extent.

On the one hand, technology has already begun to revolutionize the way we learn. Online education, for example, has become increasingly popular and has allowed individuals to access educational resources from anywhere in the world. In addition, virtual classrooms and video conferencing have made it possible for students and teachers to connect and communicate without the need for a physical classroom. Furthermore, the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning has also impacted the way we learn. These technologies can personalize learning experiences for each individual, allowing students to work at their own pace and receive customized feedback. This has the potential to transform traditional teaching methods and create a more individualized approach to education.

However, I do not believe that the typical teaching situation will completely disappear. The physical presence of a teacher in the classroom can be invaluable, as it provides students with the opportunity to ask questions, receive immediate feedback, and engage in group discussions. The classroom environment also promotes socialization and collaboration, which are essential skills for students to develop. Moreover, the traditional teaching situation provides a sense of structure and routine that can be beneficial for students. The physical classroom creates a learning space where students can focus and eliminate distractions. It also establishes a routine for students, which can help them develop good study habits and time management skills.

In conclusion, while the teaching situation in the year 2050 may be different from what we know today, I believe that the traditional classroom setting will still exist to some extent. While technology may transform the way we learn, the physical presence of a teacher and the classroom environment provide benefits that cannot be replaced by digital tools. Therefore, it is important to embrace technological advancements while also recognizing the value of traditional teaching methods.

title: More and more people move from the countryside to big cities. Does this development bring more advantages or disadvantages to the environment

To provide sufficient housing for residents, parks and green lands are replaced by residential buildings. When the open spaces in the urban areas could be used up, a common practice is to reclaim more land from the suburban area, which is considered an unsustainable way. The reduction of greenery coverage and the damage to the ecological environment are unavoidable as the limited  resources cannot accommodate so many dwellers in metropolises.

The large number of urban populations is also responsible for various kinds of pollution. Air pollution has become a big concern that plagues inhabitants and the main source of air pollutants is the growing number of private cars. Moreover, in order to create more jobs to meet the demand for employment, many factories are built inside or around there, and they emit waste gas into the atmosphere, pollute the water and soil surrounding there and create a lot of noise with their machinery.

Some may argue that with immigrants moving from the countryside to cities, the rural areas can benefit in terms of the environment. However, these benefits are not comparable to the problems faced in metropolises. The vast space of the countryside has an advantage in cleansing the pollutants, and the pollution generated by its sparse population is much less than that in the densely-populated cities.

Overall, in the process of urbanization, many environmental issues may occur and need to be dealt with in a proper manner.

Firstly, aluminium cans must be collected in special containers for reusable products. And these containers are brought to recycling factories, where the process of waste recovery begins. Secondly, all amassed jars are cleaned and sorted out in order to get rid of waste. Then, the products go through specialized machines which shred them into tiny pieces. In the next step, the pieces are compressed to form a metal block. 

Next, the blocks are put into giant ovens that heat them under particular degrees for melting. After being softened, the aluminium is passed between two big rollers that flatten it from 2.5 mm to 6 mm thick, according to its application. Finally, flattened metal is delivered to special factories that produce drinking products, where canisters are filled with drinks and distributed to shops and local markets for consumers. In the UK 74% of distributed aluminium jars are reused.

  To begin with, the digital revolution has offered unprecedented access to a vast array of information and therefore radically reformed traditional teaching methods and approaches. Students, irrespective of their geological location, are now able to watch lectures delivered at reputable academies as well as study scientific research in a variety of fields on the Internet, which would not be otherwise available in traditional classes. Thus, a plethora of information is likely to foster not only students' independent learning but also their intellectual curiosity. Furthermore, these active learners can learn at their own pace and level with a view to optimising their learning outcomes.  

  On the other hand, it is indisputable that traditional schooling has multifaceted benefits which go beyond the delivery of academic content. Firstly, it creates an academic atmosphere with both dynamic interaction and healthy competition between students. By conferring with their partners, each student has the propensity for pursuing a "debate culture", which is the key element in cultivating an immense sense of industry and competitiveness among them.For this reason, traditional classes act as a driving force in improving learners' interpersonal skills and peer support for mutual development. Meanwhile, instructors also play an important role to interpret abstract concepts into straightforward ones, helping students have thorough insights into lessons and accumulating a broad educational background.

  In conclusion, although the adoption of technology has been a crucial breakthrough , I have a staunch belief that schools are essential for children's development.

title:
In some country, more people are choosing to live alone. 

Do you think it has positive or negative effects on them?
content:
Opinions are divided on whether it is beneficial  or detrimental when an increasing number of today's people are opting for a solitary lifestyle. This essay will explore both positive and negative effects on individuals.

Living a solitary life, on the one hand, could be disadvantageous, for various reasons related to loneliness and difficulties when they change their mind. The solo dwellers might feel lonely or even  isolated in some emotionally vulnerable moments while there is no one around, it becomes a struggle for them to unburden themselves. This circumstance exacerbates  people who live solitarily, causing them to suffer from mental and emotional issues which leads directly to an unhealthy mental life. In addition, the further explanation for this sensation is the negative feelings during festive seasons. When solo dwellers glimpse happy couples and joyful families. Alongside this, the decision to live alone could be temporary. Therefore, once they want to change in order to start a family, this intention might be far from a straightforward task.

Despite the aforementioned downsides, this way of living could have its own merits, chief among which are a sense of freedom and self-improvement. People who choose to live alone will have some leeway to enjoy the independence of life without considering worrying about others' opinions or criticisms from co-living partners. For instance, solo dwellers can refurbish their nest or throw away a late-night party in the absence of their parent's preferences and limitations. Additionally,  solo living is said to be the most advantageous lifestyle that makes it easier for people to enhance their career. They will have chances to take advantage of their alone time and space to develop their personal skills, for example, financial management, repair skill, cooking, etc... as well as nurture their individual interest. If they settle for a co-living way of life which means living with their parents or spouses, they tend to count on the others.

In conclusion, I contend that the desirable experience of solo living could have both favourable impacts from an individual perspective.
